snippet: After Stuart Broad did not disagree with an umpire who erroneously ruled that his bat did not strike a ball, cricket traditionalists said it was the latest example of an erosion in sportsmanship.
abstract: Cricket traditionalists say incident in which English player Stuart Broad failed to confess that he was out, even tough the umpire ruled him in, is a disgraceful reflection of how low the game has fallen; cricket players are expected to adhere to what is broadly known as the spirit of cricket, in which fair play and sportsmanship trump competitiveness and ruthlessness.
lead_paragraph: After Stuart Broad did not disagree with an umpire who erroneously ruled that his bat did not strike a ball, cricket traditionalists said it was the latest example of an erosion in sportsmanship.

headline.main: Debate Erupts After English Player Fails to Call Himself Out
headline.print_headline: Is It Cricket? Beneficiary Of Bad Call Fuels Debate
